intro: Dryadella osmariniana, commonly known as the Persian bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountains of Iran and Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable addition to rock gardens or alpine settings. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant flowers and compact growth habit.
